title: Is Riot Ruining League
body:
Here I am, posting what could be the last of my Riot Game's experience: watching as they send what was once a great game down the gutter, after playing it for years. 

The new champion buffs are new either making or breaking champions. Take the newly reworked Graves for example. I rarely see a graves lose lane due to his high burst, mobility and aoe damage. His recent win rate is pathetic, with 56% over 1250 games. And the juggernaut release in general was an absolute flop. Tank and high, true damage riot? With all the releasing of new, 'op' champions, why are we suddenly deciding to nerf Riven? I acknowledge that she is strong but she fits in nicely with all the newly reworked champions, because they're all strong, too. Also, why does Riot believe that adding 'minigames' to champions (Skarners pillars, Bard's chimes, Kindred's stacks etc.) is helping in any way to balance a champion. I feel that they are excessive. It feels like this game is turning into DOTA, where all the champs are stupidly op, therefore balanced. But the transition is odd, Riot is buffing champions one by one, ruining the game until the transition is over. They talk of 'strategic diversity', but I don't feel that this is so, they still have recommended items, which I normally build every game, regardless of the situation. Maybe that's just a bad habit, I don't know. I've never felt like we need more bans for ranked, but with the uprising of all these reworked champions, I don't want any of them intruding in games of which I actually want to win.

That's just a rant of mine, needed to let off some steam. Hopefully you agree, and hopefully Riot will realize the mistakes of which they've made.
See you on the Rift..
NOT

I could be proven entirely wrong about this but like, I think the kinds of games that are not being produced by massive companies such as riot are plateauing. Rationale for this is how can a team of developers with less funding etc rival with riots abundance of resources that they can throw at any issue. I think that LoL will dominate the MOBA market for several more years to come just like how Blizzard has managed to monopolise mmorpg's so successfully with WoW. I think the issue is not in Riot not making money but potentially that there being no growth factor. Personally I think they should cut into the market of other gaming genres turn this into a big label like Blizzard has done by creating other games. However... I do find it a little stagnant and lacking in the fact that the one real draw that DOTA 2 has over LoL and the only real advantage it has over Riot in terms of how they think is that they let other people do the thinking for them. Create a virtual game designer like Warcraft III had that enables triggers etc to form so people can make tower defences, etc... And maybe a new genre will form and then you can pounce on that and make it another part of Riot's claim to fame by revamping it visually and conceptually in the long term. Generating new champions and redirecting peoples attention to buying those new champions can only generate so much money.

To briefly reiterate I think the game needs a custom game making tool then millions of people will convert back from DOTA 2 to LoL.

I couldn't disagree with half the comments more... The new masteries are actually really really good, maybe a little more confusing at times but if you actually spend like 45 minutes to watch phreaks analysis of them or actually read a few guides on the masteries changes you'll actually see that the games just becoming more customisable. Then you talk about Riven nerfs as being a bad thing but nerfs in one elo don't make sense to some players because certain champions are stronger in their respective elos for example rivens in low elo kinda suck all the time but then you watch pro teams on riven and fiora and irelia all these champions that make no sense in low elo... And balancing is hard there are over 120 champions when you think how many variables change the outcome of each fight and knowing that sure a jinx/graves/vayne might kill you in one less auto or something, I consider that very decently balanced and that discovering which champions are powerful at a respective time is part of playing into the strategy of the game.

P.s. awesome work riot. love all the s6 changes.

Look at Riven:
- high damage
- high mobility 
- AOE stun, low cooldown
- ranged ultimate / huge steroid, low cooldown
- resilient even with damage items

Where are the weaknesses? You can't beat her 1v1 if she has her ult, unless she misplays. Her only weakness is that Riven players tend to get too cocky because she's so OP.

Riot seems to underestimate mobility in this game. The same deal is with all other high mobility/ high damage / tanky champs like Lee and Gnar.
